body:
### Problem

```cpp
#0  0x000055e555c13954 in marktree_itr_next_skip (b=b@entry=0x55e557b567e0, itr=itr@entry=0x7ffda31ab570, skip=skip@entry=false, preload=preload@entry=false, oldbase=oldbase@entry=0x0, meta_filter=meta_filter@entry=0x0)
    at .../src/nvim/marktree.c:1529
1529          assert(itr->x->ptr[itr->i]->parent == itr->x);
[Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7f8b97563b80 (LWP 2287250))]
(gdb) bt
#0  0x000055e555c13954 in marktree_itr_next_skip (b=b@entry=0x55e557b567e0, itr=itr@entry=0x7ffda31ab570, skip=skip@entry=false, preload=preload@entry=false, oldbase=oldbase@entry=0x0, meta_filter=meta_filter@entry=0x0)
    at .../src/nvim/marktree.c:1529
#1  0x000055e555c16125 in marktree_itr_next (b=b@entry=0x55e557b567e0, itr=itr@entry=0x7ffda31ab570) at .../src/nvim/marktree.c:1479
#2  0x000055e555c16167 in marktree_itr_step_out_filter (b=0x55e557b567e0, itr=0x7ffda31ab570, meta_filter=0x55e555e4d320 <sign_filter>) at .../src/nvim/marktree.c:1579
#3  0x000055e555b3cd6c in decor_redraw_signs (wp=0x55e557b50be0, buf=0x55e557b53850, row=34, sattrs=0x7ffda31abb80, line_id=0x7ffda31ab7b0, cul_id=0x7ffda31ab7ac, num_id=0x7ffda31ab7a8)
    at .../src/nvim/decoration.c:694
#4  0x000055e555b47516 in win_line (wp=wp@entry=0x55e557b50be0, lnum=lnum@entry=35, startrow=startrow@entry=4, endrow=41, col_rows=col_rows@entry=0, spv=0x7ffda31acd10, foldinfo=...)
    at .../src/nvim/drawline.c:1213
#5  0x000055e555b4f1d9 in win_update (wp=wp@entry=0x55e557b50be0) at .../src/nvim/drawscreen.c:2291
#6  0x000055e555b50098 in update_screen () at .../src/nvim/drawscreen.c:640
#7  0x000055e555c445c5 in normal_redraw (s=s@entry=0x7ffda31ace40) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:1355
#8  0x000055e555c46248 in normal_check (state=0x7ffda31ace40) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:1451
#9  0x000055e555ce6e4e in state_enter (s=0x7ffda31ace40) at .../src/nvim/state.c:40
#10 0x000055e555c43e24 in normal_enter (cmdwin=<optimized out>, noexmode=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:516
#11 0x000055e555c08cb1 in main (argc=3, argv=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/main.c:651
```

### Steps to reproduce

At the moment I have no idea how to reproduce it.

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev-2158+g13d50c3b1

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

-

### Operating system/version

Debian Sid

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.13.1

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

from repo

comment_data.body:
This reproduces the crash @bfredl (`itr->x->s->i_ptr[itr->i] == NULL`):
```lua
local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('')
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(0, 0, 0, 0, {'a'})
for i = 0, 104 do
  vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 0, 0, {hl_group = 'Error', end_col = 1})
end
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 0, 0, {sign_text = 'S1'})
```

> This reproduces the crash @bfredl (`itr->x->s->i_ptr[itr->i] == NULL`):
> 
> ```lua
> local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('')
> vim.cmd.call("setline(1, ['aaa', 'bbb', 'ccc']->repeat(12))")
> for i = 0, 35 do
>   vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, i, 0, {hl_group = 'Error', end_col = 1})
>   vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, i, 1, {hl_group = 'Error', end_col = 2})
>   vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, i, 2, {hl_group = 'Error', end_col = 3})
> end
> vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 0, 0, {sign_text = 'S1'})
> ```
That's it!

I'm able to reproduce a similar crash by opening a ~400 line file, and spamming `gg` and `GG` in normal mode. 

```
$ nvim --version
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2164+gdc466f9a6
Build type: Debug
LuaJIT 2.1.1705947465
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

@alichtman Please try latest master with the pushed fix (#27145)

I didn't have a debugger attached this time, but it crashed on the same line

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/20600565/92e09ca2-48f9-482c-8f9e-18324b9aa5b7)

```
$  nvim --version
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2165+gd3fa8adea
Build type: Debug
LuaJIT 2.1.1705947465
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

Unfortunately I can still get neovim to crash with PR https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27147.

```
$ nvim --version
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2165+gd3fa8adea
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1705947465
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

Crash:
```
nvim: repo/neovim/src/nvim/marktree.c:1529: marktree_itr_next_skip: Assertion `itr->x->ptr[itr->i]->parent == itr->x' failed. 
```
@nagua need a full stacktrace for that.

Here is the stacktrace:

```

Now the repro from @luukvbaal does not cause this failure for me. Thanks @bfredl 

I didn't tested the current master in my regular env yet.

@nagua are you sure? 

```
#8  0x0000558203485e9d in marktree_itr_next (b=b@entry=0x55820547f7e0, itr=itr@entry=0x7ffef1bc0d88) at /home/nicolas/repo/neovim/src/nvim/marktree.c:1479
#9  0x0000558203486379 in marktree_itr_get_ext (b=b@entry=0x55820547f7e0, p=..., p@entry=..., itr=itr@entry=0x7ffef1bc0d88, last=last@entry=false, gravity=gravity@entry=false, oldbase=oldbase@entry=0x0, meta_filter=0x5582036f42d0 <inline_filter>)
```
The only direct call from `marktree_itr_get_ext` to `marktree_itr_next` is removed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27147

Could you guys create a release with this fix ? I believe it is affecting 100% of people that downloaded the last release, and no way to get it fixed unless we actually build it ourselves from master, thanks

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Crash after marktree changes (`assert(itr->x->ptr[itr->i]->parent == itr->x);`)
